Module sims.custpoint
Package sims.custpoint.controller

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
sims.custpoint.controller.LoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class LoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controls the logic of the Login screen such as validating username/passwords, publishing logs, and routing to the main menu screen upon successful validation.

  • Constructor Details

    • LoginController

      public LoginController()

  • Method Details

    • onClickSubmit

      public void onClickSubmit(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      A method that will determine if all fields are filled out, and if so it will query the database to see if a matching user can be found. If there is one, the user will be sent to the main menu, otherwise an error will display. Lastly it will call a method to log the attempt in a local text file.
      Parameters:
      e - The button click event on the Submit button.

    • onEnteringDataClearWarnings

      public void onEnteringDataClearWarnings()
      A method that clears any error messaging data upon changing text.

    • onClickQuitButton

      public void onClickQuitButton()
      LAMBDA FUNCTION: the ifPresent() method on the Alert class takes a function as an argument, allowing for a lambda expression to be passed in. This can avoid an extra, unnecessary layer of functional decomposition by creating an anonymous function to be run on its value. Allows a user to shut down the Scheduling application. The text's language is set by their location.

    • writeAccessLog

      private static void writeAccessLog(String userName, boolean isSuccess)
      Writes log information into a local file to track login attempts. Depending on the parameters, the file will mark the username as a failed or successful owner of an attempt.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the user attempting to access the application.
      isSuccess - A boolean marking that the login attempt was successful or not.

    • setLabels

      private void setLabels()
      Sets the various labels, buttons, and other displays to either English or French depending on the user's location.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)

      public static void main(String[] args)
